Subjective: Sore left ear. Water sensation, pain, and hearing loss. Unable to swim due to pain. No fever, no headache. No painkillers taken. Pain manageable, 4/10. Pain worsens after showering. Annoying for hearing. Scared of ear damage. Wants pain to stop.
Objective: Vitals: Temp 36.2Â°C. Physical Exam: Right ear normal. Left ear: inflamed ear canal, swollen, red, and thick. Eardrum not visible.
Assessment: Left ear canal inflammation, likely due to frequent wetting and cotton bud use. No signs of infection or other conditions.
Plan: Take up to 4000mg paracetamol/day if necessary.
Use anti-inflammatory ear drops 3x/day for 1 week.
Avoid cleaning ear with cotton buds.
